results.title: Teaching sign language to the chimpanzee
results.brief_description: Under the auspices of the University, Drs Allen and Beatrice Gardner conducted a study concerned with human communication with animals. Sign language was the method selected and a female chimpanzee was chosen as the research subject. This film follows the chimpanzee’s progress from infancy to nearly five years of age.

results.title: Teaching judo. Part 2. Introductory techniques
results.brief_description: Following Judo Part 1 the film is screened entirely with ground work (newaza). It does not concentrate on technical details but allows the novice to try the skills encouraging him to perform it his own way. Technique comes from movement experienced in the initial stages.

results.title: Teaching judo. Part 1. Introductory techniques
results.brief_description: Shows how a group of schoolboys using ordinary gymnasium equipment can be introduced to judo. Object is to produce full active participation, early experience of the throwing movement, and full movement range for each individual. A logical progression through various developing stages.

results.title: Teaching adults to read
results.brief_description: Based on Tom McFarlane’s book of the same title, the film sets out to demonstrate the wide range of reading activities that can be used. Intended for use on tutor training courses.

results.title: Teachers of the world. Part 2
results.brief_description: Globalisation of information, new technologies, the changing nature of our lives, are factors forcing educators everywhere to face an unprecedented period of reassessment. The teachers in this video are meeting this challenge head-on. “Korea” : a teacher uses drawings and cartoons to teach geometry. “United States of America” : an history teacher creates an experimental learning situation to foster an understanding of social injustice in her students. “Poland” : a teacher has his students exploring tradition and cultural taboo in relation to change and compromise.
results.description: Globalisation of information, new technologies, the changing nature of our lives, are factors forcing educators everywhere to face an unprecedented period of reassessment. results.title: Teachers of the world. Part 1
results.brief_description: Globalisation of information, new technologies, the changing nature of our lives and our work, are factors forcing educators everywhere to face an unprecedented period of reassessment. The teachers in this video are meeting the challenge head-on. “Australia”: Stephanie Lawrence, a teacher from Devonport, Tasmania, uses self actualisation techniques to develop her students self-esteem. “Japan”: Shigeto Honda, a teacher from Ichikawa City near Tokyo, teaches his students about the diversities of Asian cultures by experiencing first hand. “Canada and Finland”: Pekka Hynninen from Rantasalmi in rural Finland takes his students on a hike and boat trip for a scientific environmental study. The class of Rachel Hunneault from Northern Ontario participates in an interactive Telecommunications Network.
results.description: Globalisation of information, new technologies, the changing nature of our lives and our work, are factors forcing educators everywhere to face an unprecedented period of reassessment. The class of Rachel Hunneault from Northern Ontario participates in an interactive Telecommunications Network.

The class of Rachel Hunneault from Northern Ontario participates in an interactive Telecommunications Network.

results.title: Teachers and pupils talking
results.creator_credit: David Seligman, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Examines the potential conflict between the teacher’s effort to control the shaping of knowledge in the classroom and the pupils’ attempts to join the shaping. Several of the strategies adopted by the teacher are noted.

results.title: Teacher, take us orienteering
results.brief_description:
A teacher is shown with a group of older primary school students outlining the principles of orienteering and putting these into practice.
Suitable for teacher training level.
